meanings.definition: A type of school or college in some Islamic countries where young people are taught about Islam.
meanings.sent1: In some Islamic countries, children attend madrasas to learn about Islam.
meanings.sent2: The madrasas in the city provide education on Islam to young students.
meanings.sent3: The madrasas were so full of eager students that they ran out of chairs!
meanings.sent4: The madrasas were like beacons of knowledge shining in the community.
meanings.sent5: The colorful banners outside the madrasas made them stand out in the neighborhood.

meanings.definition: A place where young people are taught about Islam.
meanings.sent1: The small madrasas in the village were the center of Islamic education for children.
meanings.sent2: Families often send their children to madrasas to learn about their religion.
meanings.sent3: The madrasas had such engaging teachers that the students never wanted to leave!
meanings.sent4: The madrasas served as nurturing grounds for young minds to grow in faith.
meanings.sent5: The serene atmosphere of the madrasas made learning about Islam peaceful and enjoyable.
